title.rendered: The Ultimate Guide to Restaurant Food Delivery Software

content.rendered:
In today’s fast-paced world, having restaurant food delivery software isn’t just a trendy addition – it’s essential to meet the demands of your customers.

With more and more people relying on online food ordering, restaurants that can’t keep up risk losing customers. Even with a strong business plan, complications can arise if your delivery system and management are not up to standard. 

So, how do you make the right choice?

Well, this blog will guide you through selecting the best restaurant management software. We’ll also compare 10 top options to help you find the perfect fit for your needs.

What is Restaurant Food Delivery Software?

Restaurant food delivery software is a tool that helps restaurants manage online orders and deliver food to customers. 

With this software, restaurants find it easy to take orders, manage deliveries, and ensure everything runs smoothly. Customers can place orders online through the apps and get their desired meal with just a few taps. So for restaurants and customers, this software is a smart solution that helps to meet demand while reducing errors.

Key Features to Look for in Restaurant Food Delivery Software

First and foremost, you must know about the key features of an ideal online food ordering system. Otherwise, while choosing, you may miss out on important features and end up having software that doesn’t serve your purpose. 

Here are some key features that you should look for: 

Order Management 

Order management system ensures smooth processing from food preparation to getting it out for delivery. It helps keep track of incoming orders, reduces errors, and speeds up delivery.

With this feature you can have improved accuracy while delivering each order to customers, save costs and time as it reduces error, and overall makes your customers happy. This is the core feature of any food delivery app and without it, no restaurant won’t be able to fulfill the orders with perfection. 

Live Order Tracking

Both restaurants and customers benefit from real-time delivery tracking. This feature offers transparency as customers know exactly when their food will arrive. Restaurants gain trust through this as they are updating every step of the way in real-time. 

Inventory Management

This feature lets you monitor stock levels and receive alerts when stocks are low. You need to know the “how much”, and “what quantity” of your inventory to run your restaurant smoothly and without missing any orders. This way you as a restaurant owner can be well prepared before the next order and serve your customers without any last-minute hassle. It also helps in maximizing profits while maintaining the quality of service and food served. 

POS System

Integrating your POS system with the software helps you save time and reduce errors in your restaurant operations. It ensures that all sales data is in sync across the board. So you won’t have to worry about manually entering transactions or dealing with any mismatches in your records.

Loyalty and Promotion Tools

Reward programs and discounts encourage repeat customers. This feature lets you create and manage promotions for your restaurant and build customer loyalty. 

We all love getting discounts and saving our pockets. Customers often visit the places where not only good food is served but also good deals exist. The sense of loyalty and exclusivity keeps them coming back to your restaurant and ultimately contributes to your revenue. 

Cross-Platform Performance

The apps your customers will use to order food and the delivery person to deliver the food should be user-friendly, intuitive, and perform well in any operating system. A responsive interface makes order placement and management easier.

Third-Party Integration

This integration option lets you partner with delivery services like Uber Eats to get more delivery options for your restaurants. Also, you can connect marketing tools and platforms to reach a wider range of customers. 

This reduces the development cost and helps you be more effective in your restaurant operations. As you’re not developing the whole system from scratch and using an integration you’re not just only saving time of yours but also your customers. Having the option of integrating third parties keeps you ahead of the competitors and retains customers. 

Push Notifications

Push notifications help to update customers on their order status or notify them of special offers. It comes with the benefits of engaging users, establishing brand consistency, creating a common communication path with customers, and overall improving the user experience of your restaurant. 

It’s an easy way to keep customers engaged and encourage them to come back to order from your restaurant again and again. 

Menu Management

A flexible menu management tool allows you to update items, descriptions, and pricing quickly. You can also create visually appealing menus with high-quality images and descriptions. 

Payment Integration

To ensure a smooth checkout process, it is a must-have feature to have. It lets you offer multiple payment methods like cards, wallets, or cash on deliver,y and your customers can choose the one most convenient to them. 

The most important fact is that it reduces the cart abandonment ratio. As they find their desired payment method while checking out there’s less chance of leaving the site without purchasing. Also, if one of your competitors doesn’t provide a specific payment method but you do, there’s a high chance of expanding your customer base through it. 

Customer Relationship Management (CRM) 

Having this feature helps you to improve your service based on your customer data. With this, you can track order history and preferences and tailor the experience for your customers. From the marketing perspective, it lets you send the right offer to the right customer segment and measure the KPI of your marketing tactics.

Analytics and Reporting 

Access to a detailed report of your restaurant gives you ideas to improve your overall operations. Analytics on sales, delivery times, and customer feedback offer insights to help you make informed decisions and identify room for any change. 

Top Restaurant Food Delivery Software Solutions

Running delivery operations of a restaurant is no small task, but the right software can make it manageable. As it is now a major part of the restaurant business, here’s a list of the top software that can help you manage deliveries of your restaurant – 

GloriaFood

This online ordering and food delivery platform helps restaurants by providing a freemium business model. Anyone, from freelancers to large enterprises, can use this solution to streamline their restaurant sales operations and manage orders. 

Pros: 

  • Accept unlimited orders through your website, Facebook page, or mobile app. 
  • Customers can reserve tables and pre-order meals which reduces wait times. 
  • The system supports multiple payment options for flexibility and convenience. 
  • Restaurants can boost their sales using the Promotions Module to offer discounts and deals to attract more customers.

Cons: 

  • The app’s loud notification sound cannot be muted and creates issues for many users. 
  • Some users have reported difficulties with receiving commission payments.

Pricing: Free (You can opt for paid premium features like online payments, promotions, and a branded mobile app for added value.)

The Foody Gram

The Foody Gram offers a commission-free online ordering and management system for restaurants. It comes with the flexibility of having its own drivers or using the platform’s drivers while dispatching the orders. 

Pros: 

  • No app is required for customers to order. So it is convenient for them to access the restaurant’s online ordering system anywhere.
  • Restaurants own their customer database and can re-market through custom coupons and targeted emails or text messages.
  • The system manages various types of orders, including pickups, deliveries, pre-orders, and reservations, all in one platform.
  • It integrates seamlessly with existing websites and social media. 
  • The menu builder lets you easily create multiple menus with various offers, customizable to the restaurant’s needs.

Cons: 

  • The basic package has limited customization options for the website design.
  • The pricing may be higher compared to some other platforms.

Pricing: Starts with $159/month 

TapMango

TapMango is an online and mobile ordering solution for restaurants and retailers. Setting up and adding features is easy with this platform. With this customer loyalty and marketing platform, restaurant owners can easily create and manage their own loyalty programs to retain customers in their restaurants 

Pros:

  • TapMango automatically segments customers based on their behavior to make targeted marketing campaigns easier and more effective.
  • You can send promotions via SMS, email, or push notifications to bring customers back and add expiring vouchers to create urgency.
  • It integrates with most POS systems that have an open API, making it adaptable to existing setups.
  • Easily manage multiple restaurant locations and run specific campaigns, share points, and get detailed reports for each location.

Cons:

  • Some users have reported slow response times from customer support.
  • TapMango’s pricing is high as per its users, which may not make it feasible for smaller businesses, even though the platform performs well.

Pricing: Request Demo for pricing information 

Restroworks

It is a cloud-based restaurant management software that provides an all-in-one solution to restaurant businesses. Restaurants of all sizes including fine dining, cloud kitchens, or large restaurants in operation like hotel chains can use this software to streamline their daily operations. 

Pros:

  • The platform simplifies inventory management, kitchen operations, and the supply chain to help streamline processes and boost profits.
  • It provides a powerful restaurant POS system for server management, customer order display, and table layouts that improve staff efficiency.
  • Restroworks offers digital ordering solutions like self-ordering kiosks, QR code ordering, and mobile app ordering for customers’ convenience. 
  • You can manage menus across multiple locations with real-time updates, customizing images, descriptions, and prices for each outlet.

Cons:

  • Some users have reported slow performance and an outdated user interface.
  • Certain features may be complex to understand and use.

Pricing: You can get an estimate based on your restaurant’s needs and preferences. 

HungerRush

Within a single dashboard, transform and manage your entire restaurant using HungerRush. This restaurant POS is designed to take orders fast and process them even faster.  

Pros:

  • The platform includes automated email and text marketing campaigns to drive repeat business. 
  • Offers a wide range of features, including online ordering, payments, marketing, and delivery management. 
  • It allows you to manage both in-house drivers and third-party services. 
  • HungerRush provides durable hardware options like POS terminals, tablets, printers, and kitchen display systems designed specifically for restaurant use.

Cons:

  • Some users have reported issues with customer support responsiveness.
  • Some users encountered technical problems or bugs.

Pricing:

Independent Operator: Starts with $99/month 

Restaurant Chains: Request Demo 

UpMenu

UpMenu is a subscription-based online ordering system and app designed for restaurants. It lets you conveniently accept customer orders through your website or app.

Pros:

  • Offers commission-free online ordering to help restaurants avoid high fees from third-party apps. 
  • Comes with over 100 pre-built website components and integrates easily with the online ordering system. 
  • UpMenu provides a free system setup as a welcome gift for new users. 
  • It offers customizable website templates that align with your restaurant’s branding without needing coding skills.

Cons:

  • Some users faced restrictions on custom integrations and account modifications.
  • A few users reported technical limitations while encountering difficulties with certain features or functionality.

Pricing: Starts at $49/month 

How to Choose the Best Restaurant Food Delivery Software

When choosing the best restaurant food delivery software, you need to consider what will work best for your business. All the efforts can go in vain if you start with software that can’t fulfill your needs. Below are some of the factors to consider if you’re wondering how you can choose the best food delivery software for your restaurant- 

Expand Your Reach with Multi Vendor Food Delivery Software 

If you’re looking to create a multi-vendor food delivery platform that connects multiple restaurants with customers in different areas, StackFood is an excellent solution. StackFood offers a comprehensive platform with essential features for managing multiple vendors, zones, and deliveries all from one dashboard. 

So if you feel like owning a platform where multiple restaurants will be able to onboard and run their business while you get multiple revenue models to earn, then you should consider checking out this system. 

Get StackFood

Final Words 

Managing hundreds of orders everyday can be challenging, but the right restaurant food delivery software can make all the difference. But the key here is to choose the right one from the sea of tools that perfectly match your restaurant’s needs. As this blog shares the details of top-notch software along with the choosing factors I hope now you can take the next big step. 

See you in the next one! 

FAQs

How do I choose between different food delivery software options?

Focus on the features that align with your restaurant’s needs, like POS integration, customer loyalty programs, ease of use, etc. Compare pricing and look at customer reviews for additional insight.

Can I customize the menu on my food delivery software?

Yes, most platforms offer menu customization options, including item descriptions, prices, and availability. This flexibility is key to meeting customer preferences.

Do I need technical knowledge to set up food delivery software?

Most platforms are user-friendly and require little to no technical skills. Many also provide setup support and tutorials to guide you through the process.
